record.title: ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, APRIL 4, 2008
record.narrative:
ORDERS FOR FRIDAY, APRIL 4, 2008 -- (Senate - April 03, 2008)

[Page: S2590]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that when the Senate completes its business today, it stand adjourned until 9 a.m. tomorrow, April 4; that following the prayer and pledge, the Journal of proceedings be approved to date, the morning hour be deemed expired, the time for the two leaders be reserved for their use later in the day, and the Senate then resume consideration of H.R. 3221, as under the previous order.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
